subject: led-manager: Updated instructions with details on using JSON at runtime
commitMessage:
led-manager: Updated instructions with details on using JSON at runtime

phosphor-led-manager now uses runtime JSON configuration when enabled.

Change-Id: I37999cb8077cb8c11eed906e9997fadc6828d25e
Signed-off-by: Vishwanatha Subbanna <vishwa@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

You have committed them to Gerrit as dependent commits.  I cannot merge the other one without merging this one in the current state.

Patch Set 4:

Could you merge this *as-is*.. That is how it has been done and is in master for sometime. Now that we can make our configurations open in master. I think we can consider this change as a new commit.

Hmm. I have a come back on this.. we have different machine configurations and I would likely add 3 json configs.

Example : led-group-config-machine_A.json , led-group-config-machine_B.json, led_group_config_machine_C.json

So, if we want to do that, we would need to do it the way I have now. Matter of fact, I can now put all those machine configs part of led-manager repo itself since we don't need to maintain anything downstream now.

So, i think we will still keep it the way it is.. Do us still have comments ?

Patch Set 10:

> > I have no idea how you having 3 JSON files is relevant to my comments that you should use a variable to install these and not replicate install code in many cases.
> 
> I don't think we are on same page. I don't understand how can you have a generic code if I want to install one.json and you want to install two.json unless the variable is an array

Bitbake recipe stage_append snippets are shell script bits.  It is trivial in shell to write a for loop that operates on a space delimited variable. We do it all the time (see SYSTEMD_ variables that install and configure services).

> Bitbake recipe stage_append snippets are shell script bits.  It is trivial in shell to write a for loop that operates on a space delimited variable. We do it all the time (see SYSTEMD_ variables that install and configure services).

I am going to abandon this commit since we are now keeping all the config files in the repo itself with install_ directive in Makefile as opposed to deploying it via bit bake file.

Abandoned

The config files are now installed through Makefile constructs
Restored

Patch Set 10:

Abandon?
Can we get this added to the recipe such that if "LEDMGR_JSON_CONFIG" != "" then this is done automatically?  We don't want/need every machine start replicating this blob.

We could do that. However, certain downstream users might chose to keep it either in the machine layer or it can be on the led-manager repo and thus can be used across all machines and in that case, it can be expressed in Makefile.am

What I suggested is that the vast majority of this can be kept in the common recipe and not replicated across machines.  Each machine can have a .bbappend with a single variable (LEDMGR_JSON_CONFIG, or whatever you chose to make it) and if that variable is not empty then this code you have here is triggered in the original recipe.

Why would "certain downstream users choose to keep it in the machine layer"?

So now the plan is that we will have 1 image that supports different system types. .. I have 3 different configurations and I need to put all of 'em in openbmc/phosphor-led-manager/configs/ and then during runtime take a decision on what to chose.

In that way, I will do these changes :

1/. in openbmc/phosphor-led-manager/ , make configs/ and copy all of these into /usr/share/

2/. Have the .bb file define OEEXTRA_CONF += "--enable-use-json"
EXTRA_OECONF = "--enable-use_json" or EXTRA_OECONF += " --enable-use_json"
EXTRA_OECONF += . Because the original .bb may or mayn't have EXTRA_OECONF and using += makes It safer.
sure, should be add spacing after ".

You mean " --enable-use-json " ?.. If so. it does not need that. 

For example: https://github.com/openbmc/openbmc/blob/master/meta-phosphor/recipes-phosphor/leds/phosphor-led-manager_git.bb#L56
sure
Please fix the code to not mix dash/underscore.
Sure.. Will modify the code
I did not want to specify this. I covered it as part of "Install the led-group-config.json to /usr/share/phosphor-led-manager/"
